body.p:
Covington July 2nd 1861
Gov B Magoffin
Frankfort Ky
Sir

I am now presenting to you as I think the case of a man that is entitled to you Executive clemency Mr Joseph Blackwell who was fined Two Hundred Dollars for selling Liquor without licens he is now in Jail and unable to pay his fine I am fully convinced that he is innocent there being but one witness and he being a drunken vagabond who swore to posative falsehoods during the trial Mr Blackwell has a family that depen upon him for support

Your obednt Servnt
Saml K Hays
